alert.note: Alert for Western Franklin; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hampshire, northwestern Franklin and northwestern Hampden Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Becket, or 10 miles southeast of Pittsfield, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding and wind gusts to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Also, a few small branches may be downed. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Buckland, Ashfield, Chester, Charlemont, Worthington, Cummington, Heath, Plainfield, Middlefield, Rowe and Hawley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Western Franklin; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire
